alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 12:18PM EST until February 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. For the Iroquois River...including Foresman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River near Foresman. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs of low lying agricultural areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Saturday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CST Saturday was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected tonight.
